result.execSummary:
The defendant EDWARD J BRANTLEY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. EDWARD J BRANTLEY is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • EDWARD J BRANTLEY was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • EDWARD J BRANTLEY was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

records.addlTxt: 10:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant EDWARD J BRANTLEY in court.  Attorney Mark Douglas Skvara in court for EDWARD J BRANTLEY. State moves to dismiss Count 1 outright. Defendant enters N.C. plea to counts 1 and 2. State also moves to dismiss repeater enhancers on both counts. State moves to amend count 2 to D.C. Both sides stipulate and Court finds factual basis for verbal conduct only. Defendant enters N.C. plea to counts 2 and 3.Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty. State and Defense make sentencing recommendation. Court orders Count 2 and 3 $150 fine and costs plus DNA.

No violent contact with J.L.B. Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No travel outside the state without prior court approval. Not possess firearms or dangerous weapons.

No violent contact with J.L.B. Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No travel outside the state without prior court approval. Not possess firearms or dangerous weapons.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant EDWARD J BRANTLEY in court.  Attorney Mark Douglas Skvara in court for EDWARD J BRANTLEY. Atty. Skvara asks for a prelim waiving time limits. State asks for $1500 signature bond with conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
